thread.title: Female teenager planned school shooting in US — police
thread.title_full: Female teenager planned school shooting in US — police

title: Female teenager planned school shooting in US — police
text:
Female teenager planned school shooting in US — police Agence France-Presse / 10:16 AM March 29, 2017 Pictures released by the Frederick County Sheriff’s Office in Maryland, United States, show items found in the house of 18-year-old Nichole Cevario. The teenager’s diary reportedly contained plans on how she would do a shooting at her school. FREDERICK COUNTRY SHERIFF’S OFFICE FACEBOOK PAGE 
WASHINGTON, United States — Police in Maryland have arrested an 18-year-old student who was planning a shooting at her school, after her family turned her in. 
Frederick County Sheriff Charles Jenkins said Tuesday that Nichole Cevario had amassed firearms and potential explosives materials, as well as instructions to make a homemade bomb. 
Cevario will now face charges of possession of explosive and incendiary material intended to create a destructive device. ADVERTISEMENT 
After being arrested Thursday, the suspect was undergoing psychiatric evaluations at a local hospital near Thurmont, about an hour outside Washington. 
If released, she would be held until arraignment. 
She planned the attack on Catoctin High School for April 5, police said. 
The plot was derailed when Cevario’s father noticed worrisome comments in her diary. 
“This event was very probably prevented by the parents who stepped forward,” Jenkins told reporters. 
“They saw something, they said something, they came forward. They did the right thing, so I give all the credit in the world to the parents of this young lady.” CBB
